001/*
002 * Renderer 18. The MIT License.
003 * Copyright (c) 2022 rlkraft@pnw.edu
004 * See LICENSE for details.
005*/
006
007package renderer.scene.primitives;
008
009import java.util.List;
010import java.util.ArrayList;
011
012/**
013   A {@code Primitive} is something that we can build
014   geometric shapes out of (a "graphics primitive").
015<p>
016   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geometric_primitive" target="_top">
017                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Geometric_primitive</a>
018<p>
019   We have twelve geometric primitives,
020   <ul>
021   <li>{@link LineSegment},
022   <li>{@link LineStrip},
023   <li>{@link LineLoop},
024   <li>{@link LineFan},
025   <li>{@link Lines},
026   <li>{@link Point},
027   <li>{@link Points},
028   <li>{@link Face},
029   <li>{@link Triangle},
030   <li>{@link TriangleStrip},
031   <li>{@link TriangleFan},
032   <li>{@link Triangles}.
033   </ul>
034<p>
035   Each {@code Primitive} holds two lists of integer indices.
036<p>
037   One list is of indices into its {@link renderer.scene.Model}'s
038   {@link List} of {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} objects. These
039   are the vertices that determine the primitive's geometry.
040<p>
041   The other list is of indices into its {@link renderer.scene.Model}'s
042   {@link List} of {@link java.awt.Color} objects.
043<p>
044   The two lists of integer indices must always have the same
045   length. For every {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} index in a
046   {@code Primitive} there must be a {@link java.awt.Color} index.
047*/
048/*
049   NOTE: The Primitive class could be an inner class of
050         the Model class. Then each Primitive object would
051         automatically have access to the actual Vertex and
052         Color lists that the Primitive is indexing into.
053*/
054public abstract class Primitive
055{
056   // A Primitive object is made up of indices to vertices and colors in a Model.
057   public final List<Integer> vIndexList; // indices for this primitive's vertices
058   public final List<Integer> cIndexList; // indices for this primitive's colors
059
060   /**
061      Construct an empty {@code Primitive}.
062   */
063   protected Primitive()
064   {
065      this.vIndexList = new ArrayList<>();
066      this.cIndexList = new ArrayList<>();
067   }
068
069
070   /**
071      Construct a {@code Primitive} with the given array of indices for the
072      {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} and {@link java.awt.Color} index lists.
073      <p>
074      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
075      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
076      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
077      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
078      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
079
080      @param indices  array of {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} and {@link java.awt.Color} indices to place in this {@code Primitive}
081   */
082   protected Primitive(final int... indices)
083   {
084      this();
085
086      for (final int i : indices)
087      {
088         addIndices(i, i);
089      }
090   }
091
092
093   /**
094      Construct a {@code Primitive} object using the two given
095      {@link List}s of integer indices.
096      <p>
097      NOTE: This constructor does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
098      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
099      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This constructor assumes that
100      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
101      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
102
103      @param vIndexList  {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} list
104      @param cIndexList  {@link List} of integer indices into a {@link java.awt.Color} list
105      @throws NullPointerException if {@code vIndexList} is {@code null}
106      @throws NullPointerException if {@code cIndexList} is {@code null}
107      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code vIndexList} and {@code cIndexList} are not the same size
108   */
109   protected Primitive(final List<Integer> vIndexList,
110                       final List<Integer> cIndexList)
111   {
112      if (null == vIndexList)
113         throw new NullPointerException("vIndexList must not be null");
114      if (null == cIndexList)
115         throw new NullPointerException("cIndexList must not be null");
116      if (vIndexList.size() != cIndexList.size() )
117         throw new IllegalArgumentException("vIndexList and cIndexList must be the same size");
118
119      this.vIndexList = vIndexList;
120      this.cIndexList = cIndexList;
121   }
122
123
124   /**
125      Add the given array of indices to the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
126      and {@link java.awt.Color} index lists.
127      <p>
128      NOTE: This method does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
129      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
130      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This method assumes that
131      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
132      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
133
134      @param indices  array of {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} and {@link java.awt.Color} indices to add to this {@code Primitive}
135   */
136   public void addIndex(final int... indices)
137   {
138      for (final int i : indices)
139      {
140         addIndices(i, i);
141      }
142   }
143
144
145   /**
146      Add the given indices to the {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} and
147      {@link java.awt.Color} index lists.
148      <p>
149      NOTE: This method does not put any {@link renderer.scene.Vertex}
150      or {@link java.awt.Color} objects into this {@link Primitive}'s
151      {@link renderer.scene.Model} object. This method assumes that
152      the given indices are valid (or will be valid by the time this
153      {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
154
155      @param vIndex  integer {@link renderer.scene.Vertex} index to add to this {@code Primitive}
156      @param cIndex  integer {@link java.awt.Color} index to add to this {@code Primitive}
157   */
158   public void addIndices(final int vIndex, final int cIndex)
159   {
160      vIndexList.add(vIndex);
161      cIndexList.add(cIndex);
162   }
163
164
165   /**
166      Set the {@link java.awt.Color} index list to the given array of indices.
167      <p>
168      NOTE: This method does not put any {@link java.awt.Color} objects
169      into this {@link Primitive}'s {@link renderer.scene.Model} object.
170      This method assumes that the given indices are valid (or will be
171      valid by the time this {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
172
173      @param cIndices  array of {@link java.awt.Color} indices for this {@code Primitive}
174      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code cIndices} does not have the correct length for this {@code Primitive}
175   */
176   public void setColorIndices(final int... cIndices)
177   {
178      if (vIndexList.size() != cIndices.length )
179         throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of color indices for this primitive");
180
181      cIndexList.clear();
182      for (int i = 0; i < cIndices.length; ++i)
183      {
184         cIndexList.add( cIndices[i] );
185      }
186   }
187
188
189   /**
190      Give this {@code Primitive} the uniform {@link java.awt.Color} indexed
191      by the given color index.
192      <p>
193      NOTE: This method does not put a {@link java.awt.Color} object
194      into this {@link Primitive}'s {@link renderer.scene.Model} object.
195      This method assumes that the given index is valid (or will be valid
196      by the time this {@link Primitive} gets rendered).
197
198      @param cIndex  integer color index to use for this {@code Primitive}'s {@link java.awt.Color}
199   */
200   public void setColorIndex(final int cIndex)
201   {
202      for (int i = 0; i < cIndexList.size(); ++i)
203      {
204         cIndexList.set(i, cIndex);
205      }
206   }
207
208
209   /**
210      For debugging.
211
212      @return {@link String} representation of this {@code Primitive} object
213   */
214   @Override
215   public abstract String toString();
216}
